\beginhymn Lumen ad revelationem gentium.

\sgn {}en\punctum b\egn
\spatium

\spatium

\beginlyrics

\hbox{
\vbox{
\hsize50mm

\verse2. Quia vid\'erunt \'oculi {\bf me}i * salu{\it t\'a}re {\bf tu}um.

\verse3. Quod pa{\bf r\'a}sti * ante f\'aciem \'omnium {\it po}pu{\bf l\'o}rum.

\verse4. Glor\'\i a Patri, et {\bf F\'\i}lio, * et Spir\'\i {\it tu}i {\bf San}cto.

\verse5. Sicut erat in princ\'\i pio, et nunc, et {\bf sem}per, * et in s\'\ae cula s\ae cu{\it l\'o}rum.  {\bf A}men.

}
\hskip5mm
\vbox{
\hsize 50mm

\it

\verse2. For my eyes have seen Thy salvation.

\verse3. That Thou hast prepared before the face of all people.

\verse4. Glory be to the Father and to the Son * and to the Holy Ghost.

\verse5. As it was in the beginning is now and ever shall be, world without end.  Amen.

}
}

\endlyrics
